org.epics.ioc.pdrv.vxi11
Interface VXI11Controller

public interface VXI11Controller

Methods for communication with a VXI11 Controller.

Author:
mrk

Status connect(VXI11User user)
Connect to the controller;

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
The status. If failure user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

isConnected

boolean isConnected()
Is the controller connected?

Returns:
(false,true) if the controller (is not,is) connected.

disconnect

void disconnect()
Disconnect from the controller.

createDevice

VXI11Device createDevice(int pad,
                         int sad)
Create interface to a VXI11 device.

Parameters:
pad - Primary Address. If -1 then connect to controller itself.
sad - Secondary Address. If -1 no secondary address.
Returns:
The VXI11Device interface.

getLockTimeout

int getLockTimeout()
Return the time interval that I/O operations will wait to obtain the VXI11 controller lock.

Returns:
Time interval, in milliseconds, that I/O operations will wait to obtain the lock.

setLockTimeout

void setLockTimeout(int msec)
Set the time interval that I/O operations will wait to obtain the VXI11 controller lock. The default lock timeout interval is 20 seconds.

Parameters:
msec - The time interval, in milliseconds, that subsequent I/O operations will wait to obtain the lock.

getIoTimeout

int getIoTimeout()
Return the time interval in which I/O operations must complete.

Returns:
Time interval, in milliseconds, in which I/O operations must complete.

setIoTimeout

void setIoTimeout(int msec)
Set the time interval in which I/O operations must complete. I/O operations which have not completed in this interval will throw an exception. The default I/O interval is 20 seconds.

Parameters:
msec - The time interval, in milliseconds, in which subsequent I/O operations must complete.

getWaitLock

boolean getWaitLock()
Will subsequent I/O and lock operations will wait for a locked device to be unlocked?

Returns:
(false,true) if (will not, will) wait.

setWaitLock

void setWaitLock(boolean state)
Set the flag which controls whether or not subsequent I/O and lock operations will wait for a locked device to be unlocked. If the flag is false, I/O and lock operations on a locked device will immediately raise an VXI11Exception. If the wait lock flag is true, I/O and lock operations on a locked device will wait up to lockTimeout milliseconds before raising the exception. The default value of the wait lock flag is false.

Parameters:
state - The value to which the wait lock flag will be set.

ifc

Status ifc(VXI11User user)
Clear the interfaces of devices. The controller pulls the bus IFC (Interface Clear) line low momentarily to clear the interfaces of all devices attached to the bus.

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
The status. If status is not success user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

getBusAddress

Status getBusAddress(VXI11User user)
Return the VXI11 bus address of the controller.

Parameters:
user - The user.
Returns:
The status. If status is success then user.getInt() has the result. If status is not success user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

                     int pad)
Set the VXI11 bus address of the controller.

Parameters:
user - The user.
pad - The value to which the controller's VXI11 talker/listener address will be set.
Returns:
The status. If status is not success user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

sendCommand

Status sendCommand(VXI11User user,
                   byte[] data)
Send arbitrary commands to the VXI11 bus. The controller asserts the VXI11 bus Attention (ATN) line and transmits the bytes to the bus.

Parameters:
user - The user.
data - The commands to send.
Returns:
The status. If status is not success user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

enableSRQ

Status enableSRQ(VXI11User user,
                 boolean state)
Enable or disable the sending of Service Request (SRQ) messages from the VXI11 controller. When Service Request messages are enabled the VXI11 controller will send a message to the controller object each time the VXI11 service request bus line changes from the inactive to the active state. The VXI11 controller object will then invoke the ieee488SrqHandler method of the object registered to handle such messages. The argument passed to the ieee488SrqHandler method is the controller object invoking the handler.

Parameters:
user - The user.
state - Enable (true) or disable (false) the sending of SRQ messages.
Returns:
The status. If status is not success user.getError() and user.getString() report cause of failure.

registerSrqHandler

void registerSrqHandler(VXI11SrqHandler srqHandler)
Register the object which will handle SRQ callbacks. When the controller object receives a Service Request (SRQ) message from the VXI11 controller it will invoke the ieee488SrqHandler method of the registered handler object. The argument passed to the ieee488SrqHandler method is the controller object invoking the handler.

Parameters:
srqHandler - The object to which SRQ messages will be sent.
